alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 24 at 8:53PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Douglas and Taney. Excessive rain was impacting the, Cowskin Creek, Bryant Creek, Beaver Creek, Little Beaver Creek, and Hunter Creek basins. * WHEN...Until 900 AM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 849 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Little Beaver Creek at Old Cheese Plant Road, Bryant Creek at County Road 223, Cowskin Creek at Highway Y, Beaver Creek at County Road 524, Bryant Creek at Highway U, Hunter Creek at Highway FF, and Little Beaver Creek at County Road 447. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ava, Goodhope, Rome, Brownbranch, Bradleyville, Brushyknob and Lake Taneycomo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
